header.h2: Connect With UCT On Social Media!

div.div: Upper Cape Cod Regional Technical School

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: As part of Governor Baker's mandate that schools remain closed, Upper Cape Tech will now be closed starting Monday, March 16th and continuing through Monday, May 4th. At this time, classes will resume on Tuesday, May 5th. This closure includes all student activities. Five school days will be made up, in the same manner as snow days, in late June. However, make-up days will not exceed our 185th day of school. Our last day of school will STILL fall on June 23, 2020.
Students are expected to log in to Google Classroom on a regular basis to keep up to date with classwork and homework.
See the FAQ document which is on our website, Facebook, and Twitter for further details.

div.strong: A status update relative to next steps will be distributed to our Upper Cape Tech community as soon as we have additional information.

p.b: Practice social isolation- only leaving home as necessary
Cover coughs/sneezes with tissues, or cough/sneeze into the inner elbow.
Practice good handwashing with soap and water as often as possible
Use alcohol-based hand sanitizers ONLY if soap and water are not available.

meta.div: We will keep you informed of any additional changes in operation as this rapidly evolving public health situation continues. Please continue to check Facebook, Twitter, and our web page for the most up to date information.

a.b: Please click here for more important information regarding COVID19- and Upper Cape Tech's preparedness and planning.
Please click here for answers to some Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs).
